Prerequisites: (A) GRADE OF "C" OR HIGHER IN ACG 4101 OR EQUIVALENT, AND (B) 60 CREDITS EARNED
Course Description: STANDARDS AND PROCEDURES OF AUDITING FINANCIAL INFORMATION, ETHICS AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF AUDITORS, COLLECTION AND DOCUMENTATION OF AUDIT EVIDENCE, REPORTING AND INTERNATIONAL AUDITING STANDARDS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
COURSE OBJECTIVES
1. KNOWING: STUDENTS WILL GAIN CONCEPTUAL EXPERTISE AND AWARENESS OF FACTS, FRAMEWORKS AND THEORIES, WHICH CONSTITUTE THE TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE OF THIS COURSE.
2. DOING: STUDENTS WILL ENGAGE IN TASKS TO APPLY TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE.
3. BEING: STUDENTS WILL IMPROVE THEIR UNDERSTANDING OF WHO THEY ARE AND HOW THEIR VALUES MATCH WITH THE VALUES OF THE UNIVERSITY AND THE PROFESSION.
4. INSPIRING: STUDENTS WILL GAIN AN UNDERSTANDING OF WHO THEY CAN BE AND HOW THEY CAN INSPIRE OTHERS.
5. NETWORKING: STUDENTS WILL PRACTICE INTERACTING WITH AND RELATING TO OTHERS.

MAJOR TOPICS
1. PUBLIC ACCOUNTING – OVERVIEW
2. DEMAND FOR AUDIT AND OTHER ASSURANCE SERVICES
3. THE CPA PROFESSION
4. AUDIT REPORTS
5. PROFESSIONAL ETHICS
6. AUDIT RESPONSIBILITIES AND OBJECTIVES
7. AUDIT EVIDENCE
8. AUDIT PLANNING AND MATERIALITY
9. ASSESSING THE RISK OF MATERIAL MISSTATEMENT
10. ASSESSING AND RESPONDING TO FRAUD RISK
11. OVERALL AUDIT STRATEGY AND AUDIT PROGRAM
12. AUDIT SAMPLING FOR TEST OF CONTROLS AND SUBSTANTIVE TESTS OF TRANSACTIONS
13. AUDIT SAMPLING FOR TESTS OF DETAILS OF BALANCES
14. AUDIT OF CASH
15. AUDIT OF INVENTORY
16. AUDIT OF THE SALES AND COLLECTION CYCLE
17. COMPLETING THE TESTS IN THE SALES AND COLLECTION CYCLE
18. AUDIT OF THE ACQUISITION AND PAYMENT CYCLE
19. COMPLETING THE TESTS IN THE ACQUISITION AND PAYMENT CYCLE
20. COMPLETING THE AUDIT
